answers.answer: My doc also switched me to dilaudid for back and joint pain as it is less addictive than oxycodone, no acetaminophen like T3's and has minimal effect on the liver.  Here in Canada acetaminophen is acceptable up to 4 g/day with a healthy liver. At 650mg every 4 hr you are getting roughly 3.25 g/day so I would definitely switch to the dilaudid.  All in all less is better for your liver anyway.  You may want to explore alternate therapies for your sciatic pain such as massage, acupuncture, nerve block etc.  Every little bit helps to protect your liver until you find out where you are with stage and extent of damage.
